title.en: Russian for Beginners II (on the Basis of English), Level A1 > A2

description.en:
Course is designed for students who have previously studied Russian for one semester and reached the level A1.
 
The topics of the course:

   Getting acquainted, telling about yourself,
   Languages and countries,
   Plural of nouns and adjectives,
   Professions,
   Instrumental case - different contexts of usage,
   Let's meet and let's go! Denoting time and place,
   Prepositional and Accusative case in different contexts,
   Buying food and cooking, visiting restaurant,
   Genitive case - different contexts of usage,
   Holidays, choosing a present,
   Dative case in different contexts,
   Adjectives and proverbs - antonyms and comparative degree,
   Telling about the weather,
   Imperfective and perfective verbs - forms and contexts of usage.
description.et:
Kursus on mõeldud üliõpilastele, kes on õppinud vene keelt ühe semestri (6 EAP). 
Kursuse teemad:
Saame tuttavaks, ennast jutustamine.
Keeled ja riigid.
Nimisõnade ja omadussõnade mitmus.
Elukutsed.
Instrumentaal kääne.
Tehkem midagi! Kus ja millal.
Prepositsionaal ja Akusatiiv käänded.
Toitu ostmine ja valmistamine. Restoranis.
Genitiiv kääne.
Pühad. Ostame kingitusi.
Daativ kääne.
Omadussõnad ja määrsõnad: vastandid ja võrdlusastmed.
Räägime ilmast.
Tegusõna aspekt.

objectives.en: The overall aim of the course is to enlarge the knowledge and to develop skills acquired at the beginner level by providing a basis for coping with different language situations. Reading, listening, writing and conversational skills will be elaborated during the course.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on edasi arendada algajate tasemel omandatud teadmisi ja oskuseid läbi erinevate keelesituatsioonide. Kursuse käigus laiendatakse lugemis-, kuulamis-, kirjutamis- ja suhtlusoskuseid. Kursusel käsitletakse erinevaid kuulamis-, lugemis- ja tõlketekste, arendatakse suhtlemist, diskussioonioskust ning tehakse tööd sõnavara ja grammatika vallas, et hakkama saada igapäevastes suhtlussituatsioonides.

learning_outcomes.en: After completing the course a student should be able to:
- use the acquired vocabulary and grammar structures in everyday situations;
learning_outcomes.et: - kasutab õpitud sõnavara ja grammatikat dialoogis ja monoloogis;

learning_outcomes.en: - describe his or her everyday activities;
learning_outcomes.et: - suudab kirjeldada oma igapäevaseid tegevusi jne;

learning_outcomes.en: - exchange essential information and express an opinion on familiar topics;
learning_outcomes.et: - suudab vahetada olulist infot ja avaldada oma arvamust tuttavatel teemadel;

learning_outcomes.en: - understand and use not complicated language in various communicational situations;
learning_outcomes.et: - osaleb lihtsates igapäevastes suhtlussituatsioonides läbitud teemadel;
- oskab kirjutada isiklikke kirju, lühikesi teateid ning sõnumeid.

grade_preconditions.et:
- Passing all the tests (at least 60% of correct answers). All midterm tests and essays must be done before 28.05.2024.
- Essays and obligatory written homeworks (must be handed in within the week of the assignment).
- Home reading control (translating and retelling short texts) and conversation with the teacher.

grade_evaluation.et: The final grade = marks of 2 tests + marks of 2 essays + mark of home reading control + 3 obligatory written homeworks + general performance during the course (attending classes, being prepared for classes, active participation)

debt_elimination.et: If the test result is 'F', student is allowed to have one more try.

description.et:
WEEK 1-2 Course introduction. Getting acquainted: introducing yourself and meeting new people.
Countries, nationalities, languages. Colours. Opposite adjectives. "Study" verbs. Telling the age.Telling names and titles.
Grammar revision: grammatical gender, adjective endings (Nom. sing., Gen. sing.), verb conjugation (present, past, future).

WEEK 3-4 Food, fruit and vegetables. Countries, nationalities, languages. Numerals. Telling address and phone numbers. Professions.
Grammar: Nom. plural of nouns and adjectives. Acc. sing. + "I love, adore, hate...". Where (Prep. sing.) and Where from (Gen. sing.). Inst. sing.

WEEK 5-6 Professions. Describing character. St. Petersburg and its sightseeings. Writing a letter. Food and drinks.
Grammar: Conditional mood (would like). Inst. sing.&plural. Short forms of adjectives. Revising cases in sing.

WEEK 7-10 Food and drinks. Russian cuisine. Telling the time. Offering, approving, refusing to do something. Let's meet and let's go! Denoting time and place.
Grammar: All cases. Imperfective/Perfective verb aspects. Basic verbs of motion.

WEEK 11-12 Expressing a need or an obligation. Buying food and cooking. At the restaurant. Holidays. Choosing a present. Telling the date.
Grammar: All cases. Imperfective/Perfective verb aspects. Demonstrative pronouns (this etc.).

WEEK 13-14 Buying a present. Giving advises and orders. Opposite adjectives. Talking about weather.
Grammar: All cases. Imperative mood. Comparative degree of adjectives and adverbs. Imperfective/Perfective verb aspects.
